sen.j: 東活映画社（とうかつえいがしゃ、1931年 設立 - 1932年 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company (established in 1931 - dissolved in 1932) was a film company once existed in Kyoto.
Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company (established in 1931 - dissolved in 1932) is a film company once existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: was を is に修正しました。
sen.e: Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company (established in 1931 - dissolved in 1932) is a film company once existed in Kyoto.

tit.cmt: summary を Summary に修正しました。

sen.j: かつてマキノ省三が1921年（大正10年）に京都・等持院境内に建設した「等持院撮影所」をその後経営していた東亜キネマが業績不振に陥った1931年（昭和6年）9月、同社の代行をする会社として設立されたのが「東活映画社」である。
sen.e: When Toa Kinema, which had been managing 'Tojiin Studio' originally constructed by Shozo MAKINO in the precincts of Toji-in Temple in Kyoto in 1921, went into a slump in business in September 1931; 'Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company' was established as an agency of the said company.

When Toa Kinema, which had been managing 'Tojiin Studio' originally constructed by Shozo MAKINO in the precincts of Toji-in Temple in Kyoto in 1921, went into a slump in business in September 1931; 'Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company' was established as an agency of the said company.

When Toa Kinema, which had been managing 'Tojiin Studio' originally constructed by Shozo MAKINO in the precincts of Toji-in Temple in Kyoto in 1921, went into a slump in business in September 1931; 'Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company' was established as an agency of the said company.

sen.j: 等持院撮影所は「東活映画等持院撮影所」となった。
sen.e: Tojiin Studio became 'Tojiin Studio of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「東活映画等持院撮影所」定訳不明。 'Tojiin Studio of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company' としました。
sen.e: Tojiin Studio became 'Tojiin Studio of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.'
Tojiin Studio became 'Tojiin Studio of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.'

sen.j: 東亜時代の撮影所長の高村正次は辞任、安倍辰五郎が所長に就任した。
sen.e: Masatsugu TAKAMURA who had been the head of the studio under the management of Toa Kinema resigned, and Tatsugoro ABE (安倍辰五郎) became the head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「安倍辰五郎」読み不明。
sen.e: Masatsugu TAKAMURA who had been the head of the studio under the management of Toa Kinema resigned, and Tatsugoro ABE (安倍辰五郎) became the head.
Masatsugu TAKAMURA who had been the head of the studio under the management of Toa Kinema resigned, and Tatsugoro ABE (安倍辰五郎) became the head.

sen.j: 安倍は東亜京都の最後の作品『薩南大評定 黄金篇』の映画プロデューサーであり、同作は翌10月15日に公開されたが、同じ座組みで製作したその続編『薩南大評定 万能篇』を10月31日に東活映画設立第一作として公開した。
sen.e: ABE had produced the last movie of Toa Kyoto, "Satsunan Daihyotei Ogonhen," which had been released the next month on October 15, and the sequel to this movie produced with the same cast, "Satsunan Daihyotei Bannohen," was released on October 31 as the first movie after the establishment of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.

ABE had produced the last movie of Toa Kyoto, "Satsunan Daihyotei Ogonhen," which had been released the next month on October 15, and the sequel to this movie produced with the same cast, "Satsunan Daihyotei Bannohen," was released on October 31 as the first movie after the establishment of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.

ABE had produced the last movie of Toa Kyoto, "Satsunan Daihyotei Ogonhen," which had been released the next month on October 15, and the sequel to this movie produced with the same cast, "Satsunan Daihyotei Bannohen," was released on October 31 as the first movie after the establishment of Tokatsu Eiga-sha Film Company.

sen.j: 同作は、後藤岱山、橋本松男、堀江大生、重政順が監督として名を連ねる大作で、羅門光三郎、原駒子、小川雪子が出演した。
sen.e: This was a huge movie in which Taizan GOTO, Matsuo HASHIMOTO, Daisho HORIE and Jun SHIGEMASA joined as the directors, and Mitsusaburo RAMON, Komako HARA and Yukiko OGAWA as the cast.
This was a huge movie in which Taizan GOTO, Matsuo HASHIMOTO, Daisho HORIE and Jun SHIGEMASA joined as the directors, and Mitsusaburo RAMON, Komako HARA and Yukiko OGAWA as the cast.
This was a huge movie in which Taizan GOTO, Matsuo HASHIMOTO, Daisho HORIE and Jun SHIGEMASA joined as the directors, and Mitsusaburo RAMON, Komako HARA and Yukiko OGAWA as the cast.

sen.j: 翌1932年（昭和7年）10月、早くも「東活」は解散、等持院撮影所は閉鎖された。
sen.e: The next year, in October 1932, 'Tokatsu' dissolved in a short term and Tojiin Studio was closed.
The next year, in October 1932, 'Tokatsu' dissolved in a short term and Tojiin Studio was closed.
The next year, in October 1932, 'Tokatsu' dissolved in a short term and Tojiin Studio was closed.

sen.j: 翌11月高村が復活し、東亜キネマを買収、「宝塚キネマ」を設立した。
sen.e: The next month TAKAMURA was reinstated and bought out Toa Kinema to establish 'Takarazuka Kinema.'
The next month TAKAMURA was reinstated and bought out Toa Kinema to establish 'Takarazuka Kinema.'
The next month TAKAMURA was reinstated and bought out Toa Kinema to establish 'Takarazuka Kinema.'

sen.j: 高村の新会社が稼動させた撮影所は御室撮影所であった。
sen.e: TAKAMURA's new company worked at Omuro Studio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: TAKAMURA's new company worked at Omuro Studio.
TAKAMURA's new company worked at Omuro Studio.

sen.j: 等持院は永遠に閉鎖、翌1933年（昭和8年）5月等持院撮影所は競売に伏された。
sen.e: Tojiin Studio was closed forever and put up for auction in May 1933.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tojiin Studio was closed forever and put up for auction in May 1933.
Tojiin Studio was closed forever and put up for auction in May 1933.

sen.j: 「東活」製作の最終作品、金田繁・大伴麟三監督、月形龍之介主演の『決戦荒神山』は、高村の「宝塚キネマ」の配給で1932年12月31日に公開された。
sen.e: The last work by 'Tokatsu' was "Kessen Kojinyama," which was directed by Shigeru KANEDA and Rinzo OTOMO starring Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA; it was distributed by TAKAMURA's 'Takarazuka Kinema' and released on December 31, 1932.

The last work by 'Tokatsu' was "Kessen Kojinyama," which was directed by Shigeru KANEDA and Rinzo OTOMO starring Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA; it was distributed by Takamura's 'Takarazuka Kinema' and released on December 31, 1932.
sen.cmt: TAKAMURA'ｓ を Takamura's に修正しました。
sen.e: The last work by 'Tokatsu' was "Kessen Kojinyama," which was directed by Shigeru KANEDA and Rinzo OTOMO starring Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA; it was distributed by Takamura's 'Takarazuka Kinema' and released on December 31, 1932.
